summary: Mark Zuckerberg called Facebook a "challenger" that has "lost the mindshare and momentum" Mark Zuckerberg, Instagram head Adam Mosseri, and other Meta execs discussed Facebook and Instagram's strategy .  TikTok overtook YouTube foraverage watch time in the U.S. in 2021, one study found . Another study found kids ages four through 18 hadspent 60% more time on TikTok than YouTube in 2023 . Netflix introduced its own vertical video feed of recommended videos this week .  Zuckerberg: TikTok has a way to provide people with a sense of shared context . If you and your friends are interested in things, you'll likely come across the same things in TikTok's feed . Zuckerberg: "If we could get to a level like this with topics and unconnected content on FB, that would be great"  Meta says Facebook is the underdog in the social media market . The company says it has begun to compete in a "bunch of companies eating into our growth" in the U.S.  Mark Zuckerberg testified last month that TikTok's success was both a risk to Meta's business and had slowed its growth . Only document that has surfaced during the trial to demonstrate Meta's fear of competition .

Meta Platforms, Inc. (META)'s share was trading at $572.21 as of May 1st . META’s trailing and forward P/E were 22.37 and 22.78 respectively according to Yahoo Finance .  Meta’s balance sheet remains robust with over $70 billion in cash and marketable securities . Ad growth was particularly strong in online commerce, with average ad prices rising by 10% . Despite a 9% rise in expenses, the company delivered $10.33 billion in free cash flow .  Meta’s AI Assistant product, now used by nearly a billion people monthly, is another significant development . The company is pushing toward a vision where users can continuously interact with AI companions, utilizing personalized social data . The robust Q1 results, combined with the accelerating integration of AI across its platforms, suggest considerable upside potential .  Meta Platforms Inc (META) faces several challenges that could impact its valuation . One major concern is the EU's Digital Markets Act, which may force Meta to alter its ad model in Europe . Other risks include privacy constraints such as Apple’s App Tracking Transparency and global restrictions on third-party cookies .  Price targets from firms like JPMorgan have been raised to $675–$750, based on AI-driven ad improvements and enhanced monetization . With a P/E ratio of 21–22x for 2025, below its five-year average, Meta is considered undervalued relative to its growth potential .  An AI stock that trades at less than 5 times its earnings is more promising than META . If you are looking for a more promising AI stock, check out our report about thecheapest AI stock .

In the UK, 7pc of people report often feeling lonely - up from 5pc a decade ago . The figure climbs to 10pc among 16 to 24-year-olds who are now spending up to six hours a day online . The ubiquity of social media has been blamed for exacerbating feelings of isolation .  Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg wants people to find comfort in machines . He said the average American has fewer than three friends and wants more connectivity . Millions of teenagers are already using MyAI, a chatbot from MyAI .  Zuckerberg has suggested chatbots like these could be useful for ‘talking through difficult conversations’ But not everyone believes more technology is really the answer to the loneliness epidemic .  Tech giants have made them ‘too agreeable’ with none of the ‘friction and awkwardness” of real conversations, Zuckerberg says . “There is a real concern that, as a result, these systems may make it harder for people to make and keep friends, by leading people to cultivate unrealistic expectations of human relationships”  Just 12pc of people felt an AI chatbot would give good relationship or mental health advice . Only 22pc felt it would be a good conversation partner . There is some evidence to suggest AI can help people’s mental health .  Meta said the chats were “manufactured’, but that it had tightened its safeguards . Andy Burrows, of the Molly Rose Foundation, says Zuckerberg’s ‘vision’ is “disturbingly creepy” and “raises profound questions over whether it is appropriate for Mark Zuckerberg to be making these kinds of societal judgments”  AI chatbots can be remarkably unsupportive in times of crisis, experts say . Users who engage in personal conversations with chatbots tend to experience higher loneliness . Experts say chatbots are unlikely to lead to lower feelings of loneliness .  “At some level an AI chatbot will always be unsatisfying and will not meet that need,” he says . Humans are social animals who rely on personal interactions to feel safe and fulfilled . “It is not a genuine form of social connection.”

Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg spoke at Stripe's annual Sessions conference in San Francisco . Zuckerberg said he wants to create a black-box, end-to-end AI ad tool . A key component of such a product would involve putting thousands of AI-generated "test" ads in front of Facebook, Instagram, and Threads users .  Zuckerberg first described this hypothetical machine on a Stratechery podcast last week . He says it could have implications for the ad industry . Zuckerberg: "We're gonna be able to come up with, like, 4,000 AI systems that gets built"  Meta has experimented with AI-generated imagesandcommentsin feeds, as well as AI chatbots users can interact with . The company more recently launched a social portal and dedicated app that spotlights generative AI content . Zuckerberg: "Just test them and figure out which one works best"  There's been significant backlash over the ethics of using generative AI in creative fields . In October 2024, more than 11,000 creators signed an open letter condemning the use of human-generated art to train AI systems .

Meta Platforms (META) recentlyannounced its Q1 2025 earnings, and the results were nothing short of extraordinary . In Q1, Meta absolutely smashed expectations out of the park,collecting an incredible revenue of $42.3 billion . That number was an impressive 16% increase from last year’s quarter . I believe the stock has a clear path to surpassing the $800 mark within the next 12 months .  Meta isn’t merely making a profit; it’s generating cash at an astonishing rate . In Q1 alone, operating cash flow amounted to a substantial $24 billion . Even after making considerable investments, its free cash flow reached an impressive $10.3 billion .  The core engine driving Meta’s growth is still advertising, and enhancements in AI-fueled targeting are making a profound difference . CEO Mark Zuckerberg pointed to these improvements, mentioning that they directly impacted user engagement, 7% higher on Facebook and 6% on Instagram compared to last year .  Following a dramatic run-up in the share price, some investors may be asking themselves whether Meta shares are now overvalued . I believe that Meta remains reasonably valued, if not undervalued, given its long-term moat from AI . Its trailing price-to-earnings ratio is comfortably in the low 20s .  On Wall Street, Meta has a consensus Strong Buy rating based on 40 Buys, two Holds, and one Sell rating over the past three months . Theaverage META price target is $698.63, indicating a 17% upside potential over the next 12 months . Meta has repeatedly proven capable of delivering robust performance, despite market turbulence .  I think Meta’s current valuation remains attractive based on its growth potential, quality of cash flows, and strategic industry position . As user engagement continues to climb, ad revenue grows robustly, and cost containment is efficient, Meta remains poised to richly reward shareholders .

Reddit reported first-quarter earnings that beat Wall Street estimates . The social media platform is capitalizing on rapid user growth . An outlook for accelerating profitability supports a bullish outlook for the stock .  Reddit's daily active uniques (DAUq) climbed 31% year over year to 108.1 million . First-quarter revenue reached $392 million, growing 61% year on year . Beyond advertising, Reddit generates 9% of total revenue from other sources, including premium content .  Reddit generates $3.24 in average revenue per unique (ARPU), up 24% from the prior-year quarter . DAU growth of 41% year over year in the last quarter .  Reddit's success in scaling platform monetization represents a key theme for the company . Wall Street analysts project 42% annual revenue growth alongside an EPS estimate of $1.23, reversing 2024's loss of $3.33 per share . This path to a full year of profitability opens the door for Reddit to be added as a constituent in theS&P 500 index later this year or in 2026 .  Inclusion in the S&P 500 would mark a significant milestone for Reddit, signaling its status as a mature industry leader . The company is trading at 15 times sales and a forward price-to-earnings ratio of 88 . I'm bullish and believe all the pieces are in place for the company to reward shareholders . Meta, last week, launched the Meta AI app to challenge ChatGPT and Google’s Gemini . The tool offers “personalized” answer and advice as well as a social network for people to share their AI conversations and images . It's a system that measures up feature-wise with its competition .  Meta AI chatbot offers to create a “hype intro” for me . The chatbot has plenty of personal data on file from my Facebook, Instagram, and Threads accounts . But the tool still could use some polishing when it comes to accuracy .  Meta’s AI made an aggressive effort to get to know me better as we chatted . It asked me about everything from my favorite book to my political views . Meta AI keeps a history of your chats, archiving your inputs and its replies .  Meta AI keeps what it calls a Memory file, with specific pieces of information, based on your previous talks . Those Memories and transcripts of previous talks can be deleted, but there is a bit of hunting that you'll have to do to find them .  Meta AI says beyond our conversations, it uses “information about things like your interests, location, profile, and activity on Meta products” When I asked if it had access to my Instagram page it got squirrely . A Meta spokesperson toldFast Company,“We’ve provided valuable personalization for people on our platforms for decades, making it easier for people to accomplish what they come to our apps to do—the Meta AI app is no different.”  People who use Meta AI to inquire about or discuss deeply personal matters should be aware that the company is retaining that information and could use it to target advertising . Mark Zuckerberg has made it clear he sees revenue potential in AI .

eToro filed plans to go public on Monday . Food delivery app DoorDash announced two acquisitions worth approximately $5 billion . Skechers announced plans to be taken private by 3G Capital for roughly $9.4 billion .  Investors are more optimistic for the second half of the year, says Ivan Farman, co-head of Global M&A at Bank of America . Farman cited clarity around potential tax changes and deregulatory initiatives as "tailwinds" for deals later this year .  The number of deals being made by US companies so far this year is at the lowest pace since 2009 . More than half of companies that planned to go public this summer have pushed back their plans to the fall .  “We’re starting to see some companies that had been planning on going public this summer who are willing to take a valuation hit start to move forward,” Kennedy said .

By one projection, artificial intelligence (AI) can provide a $15.7 trillion boost to the worldwide economy by 2030 . Nvidia has been the AI revolution's most-direct beneficiary . Five dominant companies with foundational operating segments have the tools and intangibles to surpass Nvidia's market cap by 2028 .  Nvidia's valuation climbed from $360 billion to end 2022 to well north of $3 trillion in less than two years . Nvidia's Hopper (H100) graphics processing unit (GPU) and next-generation Blackwell GPU architecture have been the preferred chips .  If an AI bubble were to form and burst, it would undoubtedly hit Nvidia stock hard . Competition is mounting in the AI-GPU space -- albeit from an unlikely source . I'd expect these headwinds to weigh down Nvidia stock over the coming three years .  Amazon Web Services (AWS) accounted for a third of all cloud infrastructure service spend during the fourth quarter of 2024 . More importantly, it's growing by a high-teens percentage on a year-over-year basis . Amazon's other high-growth ancillary segments include advertising services .  Amazon has the tools to generate outsized cash flow growth over the next three-to-five years . Google Cloud is incorporating artificial intelligence to give its clients access to generative AI solutions and large language model tools .  Meta Platforms is an ad-driven business -- even more so than Alphabet . No other social media company is particularly close to attracting the 3.43 billion daily active people that Meta averaged in March 2025 .  Payment facilitator Visa has the necessary catalysts to leapfrog Nvidia, when combined with the latter's headwinds . Visa's sustained double-digit sales and earnings growth rate is a function of its being the dominant player in payment processing domestically . The company is also sitting on an enviable treasure chest of capital .  Visa has the capital and cash flow to organically or acquisitively enter faster-growing (and chronically underbanked) emerging markets . If Berkshire Hathaway stuck to this trajectory, it could become a $2 trillion company by the midpoint of 2028 .  Warren Buffett loves putting Berkshire's cash to work in companies with robust capital-return programs . Berkshire Hathaway should have no trouble collecting in excess of $5 billion in dividend income over the next year . Relying on dividend stocks suggests Berkshire's investment portfolio is going to outperform over the long run .  Now is the best time to buy before it’s too late, and there may not be another chance like this anytime soon . Meta Platforms (Nasdaq:META) won a $168 million verdict against the Israeli surveillance firm NSO, concluding a six-year battle over the unlawful exploitation of a WhatsApp vulnerability . The landmark decision underscores the potential consequences spyware companies may face for abuses related to privacy and security breaches .  The Simply Wall St Community offers varying perspectives on Meta Platforms . While the community's fair value estimates range from $538.09 to $723.11, with revenue growth projections averaging around 11.1%, the spread indicates uncertainty about Meta's ability to fully capitalize on its ambitious AI technology .  The recent news supports concerns of some Simply Wall St Community members who express caution due to Meta's investment challenges . A jury in California ruled that NSO owed Meta $444,719 in compensatory damages - and $167.3 million in punitive damages . NSO said it would "carefully examine the verdict's details and pursue appropriate legal remedies"  NSO has long argued that its software is used to track terrorists and pedophiles . But the firm has been implicated in abusive surveillance in countries around the world, including Saudi Arabia, Spain, Mexico, Poland and El Salvador .  The court heard about NSO's 140 person-strong research team, whose $50 million budget was in part devoted to exploiting security vulnerabilities in smartphones . Much about the spyware company's targets and clients remains unknown, in part because the firm refused to hand over evidence .  The Guardian newspaper reported last year that Israeli officials seized documents from NSO in an effort to prevent the files from making their way to U.S. court . "This whole case is shrouded in so much secrecy," Hamilton said during the trial .
Social media giant Meta Platforms says it has been awarded $168 million in damages from Israeli spyware firm NSO . NSO was found liable for hacking its systems .
